intro: Statice limonium var. californica, commonly known as California sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California. It is characterized by its narrow, silver-green leaves and striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for coastal and sandy environments. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
